name: Javier Restrepo
comment:
I‚Äôve been a member at David Lloyd Serrano (Madrid) for some time now, and I‚Äôm honestly very disappointed with how the gym is being managed lately.

Cleanliness and organization at opening:
Every single morning when the gym opens, the workout area is not cleaned or organized. Plates / discs are scattered, dumbbells are misplaced, and the floor is visibly dirty. This is completely unacceptable ‚Äî opening time should mean the gym is ready for members, not that we have to train around yesterday‚Äôs mess. I‚Äôve raised this issue directly with the manager on several occasions, but all I ever get are standard, templated replies with no actual change or follow-through. It‚Äôs a basic expectation for a club of this supposed standard, and yet it‚Äôs consistently ignored.

Removal of key equipment without notice:
Recently, management decided ‚Äî without any communication to members ‚Äî to remove several pieces of essential equipment from the main workout area, including hexagonal dumbbells, kettlebells, and medballs. These items were used daily by many members and were a crucial part of the free-training area. Removing them without warning or explanation has negatively affected everyone‚Äôs training experience. It shows a complete lack of consideration for the paying members who rely on that equipment. The equipment should be brought back.

At this level of membership pricing, one expects professional management, proper maintenance, and transparent communication. Unfortunately, none of those standards are being met right now. Unless there is a serious change in how this gym is run, I cannot recommend David Lloyd Serrano to anyone expecting quality, consistency, or accountability.

comment:
David Lloyd Serrano has been a disappointing experience and not at all worth the high price. They promise top-tier facilities and a high-end experience, but what you actually get is an overcrowded, overpriced nightmare that traps you in a never-ending subscription scam.

Overcrowded at All Hours ‚Äì No matter what time you go, the gym is always packed, making it nearly impossible to use machines or find space to work out comfortably. For a gym that charges ‚Ç¨150 per month, you‚Äôd expect better crowd management, but it feels more like a budget gym during peak hours‚Äîexcept it‚Äôs always peak hours here.

Difficult to Cancel Membership ‚Äì Be very careful before signing up, because canceling is extremely difficult. They rarely pick up the phone, emails go unanswered, and the process is unnecessarily complicated. Many members, including myself, have struggled to stop payments even after following their cancellation procedure.

Customer Service Needs Improvement ‚Äì The staff is not particularly helpful and can come across as dismissive when you ask for assistance. For a premium-priced gym, I expected a much better level of service.

Not Worth the Cost ‚Äì The facilities do not justify the price tag. Basic-Fit, which is one of the most affordable gyms in Madrid, offers a similar or even better experience for a fraction of the price.

Overall, I dont recommend this gym based on my experience. There are better options in Madrid that offer more value for money and a smoother customer experience.

I've been a member for four years and I can't imagine going to another club in Madrid (I've tried others, regretted it). The quality of the machines is top-notch and it also includes a heated pool, sauna, and ice bath. I also love that it has a restaurant that serves healthy meals every day with different choices.

Regarding the staff, they're wonderful. I've been training with Mario, my personal trainer, for years now and working with him changed my perspective on exercise. He's been especially great to work with because he's taken my injuries into account and always modifies the session if I'm in pain or can't do something.

I also can't help but gush about the restaurant staff. They're the type that remember your orders, ask you about what's happening in your life, and create a nice atmosphere to be around. The restaurant and its staff is no doubt that separates this club from others in the city. It's also great as a co-working space, and it's common to see laptops in the lounge.

TLDR; Great club, great equipment, great personal trainers. If you're looking for an amazing and healthy meal, this is where you go.

comment:
I‚Äôm writing this review after several incidents to express my deep dissatisfaction with the experiences my friend and I have had at the David Lloyd Club in Serrano. While the gym's facilities are satisfactory (though old/in need of maintenance), the behaviour of certain staff members and the handling of memberships have been deeply concerning and unprofessional.

Firstly, my friend and I joined the gym in the summer of 2023, taking advantage of a summer membership discount. Despite this, the gym has repeatedly attempted to charge my friend for an annual membership he never signed up for, demanding an outrageous sum of 3000 euros. This ongoing issue has caused significant stress and inconvenience, particularly as my friend, a Venezuelan national, feels unfairly targeted. In contrast, I, a Spanish national, have had no such issues with my payments. This discrepancy raises questions about the club's integrity and the fairness of its practices.

Secondly, an incident involving a Pilates instructor has left a lasting negative impression. This instructor - Ana, unprofessionally threw a tantrum in front of other students when I went to thank her after her class, simply because I unfollowed her on Instagram. To add to this, she rescinded her class invitation to me, despite having already completed said class and having previously confirmed my participation in writing. Such childish and unprofessional behaviour from a staff member is entirely surprising and unacceptable.

Additionally, when I went to reception to inform them of this situation and to pay for my pilates class, a staff member (blonde woman), was unnecessarily unpleasant about the whole situation. At least I was not made to pay for the class, TYSM, but her attitude is far from what one would expect from a healthcare provider, contributing to an overall toxic environment at the club.

While David Lloyd Club may boast okay-ish facilities, the toxic behaviour from staff and mishandling of memberships are unacceptable. There are plenty of competitors offering better price points, superior facilities, and kinder, more professional staff. I would not recommend David Lloyd Club to anyone seeking a positive and respectful gym experience and urge you to read the rest of the negative reviews before joining.
